title: Styring 2012 Reckless Red (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: This blend of Petit Verdot (65%) and Cabernet Sauvignon is an aromatic brooder, with notes of lemon peel, flowers and cherry. Bright acidity livens up the palate, which is full of cherry flavors and well-integrated tannins. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.

title: Solitary Cellars 2013 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: A touch of new oak in the aroma and bright raspberry and cherry in the flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to sip and enjoy. Typical for the grape variety, it has noticeable liveliness in the texture and a bit of tang on the finish.

title: Spann Vineyards 2013 Smoke Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: A lift of 5% Viognier contributes to this wine's rose-like floral aroma. Plum-inflected on the palate, it offers a punch of oak and tannin that softens slowly over a backdrop of smoky cured meat flavor.

title: Raptor Ridge 2015 Gran Moraine Vineyard Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This barrel-fermented wine is a most pleasant quaffer. A mix of yellow apple and pink grapefruit flavors, along with some skin phenolics, power on through. It was fermented in 10% new oak, and a hint of that pops up in the finish, an impression of candied orange peel. Drink now through 2022.

title: Le Petit Caillou 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This is made from the young vines of the Borie properties in Saint-Julien. It is sophisticated and ripe, with attractive juiciness and red cherry fruit. This is a wine that has much of the style of appellation without great structure or density.

title: Left Bend 2015 Last Straw Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This dessert blend of 66% Zinfandel, 21% Carignane, 8% Syrah and 5% Mourvèdre begins with a pruney and alcohol-laden nose, but then peppercorn, clove, Indian spice and plum skin aromas emerge. The palate is tense despite the wine's 11% residual sugar, with dried red and black fruit flavors, spicy acidity and a vanilla finish.

title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Bianco White (Pomino)
description: Made predominantly from Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco, this opens with delicate white flower and orchard fruit aromas. The bright palate offers yellow apple, lemon and rosemary flavors, set against fresh acidity.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Reserva de la Familia Sparkling (Cava)
description: This fits properly into the brut nature category courtesy of neutral aromas and a direct tightly built palate. Mild citrus and melon flavors lose some clarity on a finish that hints at mealy apple and butter.

title: Michele Satta 2014 Diambra Red (Toscana)
description: Made predominantly of Sangiovese grapes, this easygoing wine offers inviting violet and red berry aromas. The straightforward palate delivers raspberry and spiced cranberry notes, with a polished tannic structure. Drink soon.

title: Galante 2012 Ace High Malbec (Carmel Valley)
description: Smoke, leather, cedar, dried red cherry and herbal spice show on the nose of this bottling, which is dark but not overpowering in aroma. Dill and pepper notes start the palate, where vibrant acidity and stiff tannins slowly reveal its blueberry, dark cherry and cranberry flavors.

title: Galante 2014 Bulls Eye Red (Carmel Valley)
description: Black cherry, crushed concrete and spicy peppercorn show on the nose of this Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah dessert blend. There are luscious ripe flavors on the palate, including crème de cassis, black plum and prune, with a gravel-like minerality lending elegance. The high alcohol is well integrated.

title: Longoria 2014 Blues Cuvée Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rick Longoria chooses a new artist every two years to illustrate this label. This vintage features 40% Cabernet Franc, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Syrah and 18% Merlot, resulting in cranberry, red cherry and dried herbs notes, with a touch of eucalyptus and pine sap. The palate offers woody cedar and juniper flavors along with tart cherry fruit.

title: Lunadoro 2012 Quercione Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Dark-skinned berry, French oak, aromatic herb and a whiff of dark spice come together on the nose of this firm red. On the palate, roasted coffee bean and star anise notes accent wild cherry fruit, while close-grained tannins provide the framework.

title: Girard 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Tropical in its pineapple and coconut scents, this white is creamy and lush. Neither overripe nor over-oaked, its finish is marked by wild vanilla.

title: Fleur de California 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Herbal and weedy on the nose, this supple yet light-bodied wine is laced with sanguine wisps of cranberry and pomegranate, with an almost carpet-like texture to the tannins. It's varietal and delicate in approach.

title: Holdredge 2014 Petits Cadeaux Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoky oak meets a soft texture that showcases black cherry and berry in this full-bodied red. It's boldly lush and seasoned in classic hints of cola.

title: Domaine Zinck 2015 Portrait Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose tells us little—there's just a hint of pear-scented freshness. The palate is light bodied and fresh with the same appetizing glints of pear. Drink soon.

title: Noble Vines 2014 667 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Red cherry and dark berry meet with fresh turned soil, tree bark and potpourri on the nose of this bottling. The palate is light in body but full of flavor, showing juniper, oregano, wild thyme, cranberry and darker boysenberry touches.

title: River's Edge 2014 Elkton Cuvée Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)
description: This value-oriented release spent time in one-fifth new oak, and it shows nicely in the nose and the flavor. Ample red fruits are coated with sweet toast and a touch of ginger cookie. The wine has excellent length and polish, especially at this price point.

title: Emina 2016 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: This blend of Verdejo and Viura opens with citrusy aromas that include tropical notes and a hint of minerality. A juicy citric palate holds orange and lemon-lime flavors, while this tastes citrusy on the finish.

title: Pietranera 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with subdued black plum and baking spice aromas. The palate reveals black cherry, white pepper and clove flavors, framed by assertive tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Pietranera 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Dark berry, pipe tobacco and baking spice aromas come together in this taut red. It's linear and straightforward, with sour cherry, cranberry and star anise flavors. Firm tannins and bright acidity provide support Drink 2019–2024.

title: Poliziano 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: French oak, coconut, chopped herb and a menthol aromas lead the nose and carry over to the palate. It's firm and marked by bright acidity, close-grained tannins and sour cherry and licorice flavors.

title: Renieri 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Mature black plum, tilled soil and mocha aromas lead the nose. On the ripe palate, hints of espresso and vanilla accented dried black cherry and blackberry jam flavors. Bracing tannins leave a grainy, teeth coating finish.

title: Marchesi Gondi 2011 Villa Bossi Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: Made of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Colorino and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has delicate aromas suggesting black-skinned fruit and tilled soil. The straightforward palate delivers prune, grilled sage and mochaflavors with a hint of leather. Enjoy through 2018.

title: Nottola 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Blue flower, underbrush, licorice and herb aromas carry over to the taut, austere palate, along with sour cherry and sage notes. The wine is firm and lean, with tightly knit tannins and brisk acidity.

title: Omero 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: There's nothing fancy here, including the modest price, but you can happily put this up against any mass-market Pinot in the same range and it will shine. Native yeasts and aging in a mix of concrete and neutral wood let the fruit be the star—pure purple berries and ample supporting acidity.

title: Omero 2015 Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Spicy, peppery and potent, this brings young fruit flavors of tangy cherry and apple. It's young enough that a certain grapey character remains, like a Beaujolais nouveau. Drink now through 2019.

title: Hacienda del Carche 2015 Infiltrado Red (Jumilla)
description: Jammy plum and raspberry aromas feed into a clampy but fresh and lightly oaky palate. Flavors of currant, herbal red berry and oak-based clove end with rustic, grabby tannins that are drying. This is a mix of Syrah, Monastrell and Garnacha Tintorera.

title: Hacienda del Carche 2015 Taus Selección Red (Jumilla)
description: Sunbaked plum and currant aromas are a touch spicy. In the mouth, this blend of 50% Monastrell, 25% Syrah and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon is full, tannic and mostly well balanced. Dense spicy plume and black-fruit plum flavors finish with rubbery grabby tannins.
